item.title: Multi-scp: copying a file to all hosts in your SSH config
item.description: I am totally reliant on my bash aliases and readline configuration. When working on a new server, the first thing I do is copy over my local Bash (~/.bashrc) and Readline (~/.inputrc) configuration files. One mildly annoying issue is when you update a config file, it’s a pain to copy it onto all your remote hosts. To scratch this itch, I wrote a simple node.js executable for copying a file to all the defined hosts in your ~/.
